title: Is the sound of the fingers hitting the fingerboard on an acoustic string bass (double bass) considered to be desirable? - Quora

response.answer_text: Generally extraneous noises produced during play are non-desirable. So that’s a “no”. However, in certain styles of music (most particularlly rockabilly) the bassist may intentionally slap the fingerboard with right hand fingers, as a form of percussion. So in that case, this sound is part of the music and desirable:
It depends on the style of music. For classical, that would be a no. For Jazz, country or other spin-offs, it could very well be desirable.
